0: Image copyright AP Image caption Major earthquakes are rare in East Africa's Great Rift Valley NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR A magnitude 5.7 earthquake has killed at least 13 people and injured 203 in northern Tanzania, the authorities say. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The quake struck close to the border with Uganda and Rwanda near Lake Victoria. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Images posted on social media showed significant damage to buildings in Bukoba, a city of more than 70,000 people where most casualties were reported. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Tremors were felt as far away as western Kenya. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "This incident has caused a lot of damage," Deodatus Kinawila, the district commissioner of Bukoba, told the BBC. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "For now, the situation is calm and under control," he said later. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Image copyright AP Image caption This boy is one of more than 200 people injured in the quake NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR "Some people have been discharged from hospital," he added. "We don't expect many more injuries." NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The US Geological Survey says the quake struck at a depth of 10km (six miles) at 15:27 local time on Saturday (12:27 GMT).
